info.title: SumUp REST API
info.description:
SumUp’s REST API operates with [JSON](https://www.json.org/json-en.html) HTTP requests and responses. The request bodies are sent through resource-oriented URLs and use the standard [HTTP response codes](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTTP/Status).

You can experiment and work on your integration in a sandbox that doesn't affect your regular data and doesn't process real transactions. To create a sandbox merchant account visit the [dashboard](https://me.sumup.com/settings/developer). To use the sandbox when interacting with SumUp APIs [create an API](https://me.sumup.com/settings/api-keys) key and use it for [authentication](https://developer.sumup.com/api/authentication).

get.description: Get payment methods available for the given merchant to use with a checkout.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: The SumUp merchant code.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.

id.description: The ID of the payment method.

Invalid_Parameter.description: One or more of the parameters are invalid.

failed_constraints.message: Currency must also be specified when filtering by amount

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

post.description:
Creates a new payment checkout resource. The unique `checkout_reference` created by this request, is used for further manipulation of the checkout.

For 3DS checkouts, add the `redirect_url` parameter to your request body schema.

Follow by processing a checkout to charge the provided payment instrument.

Checkout.description: Standard request body for creating a checkout

CheckoutAPM.description: Create an Alternative Payment Method checkout

Checkout.description: Standard response body for a successfully created checkout

Checkout3DS.description: Response body for a successfully created 3DS checkout

CheckoutAPM.description: Response body for APMs, including Blik, iDeal, ...

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Forbidden.description: You do not have the required permission for making this request.

Existing_Checkout.description: A resource with the specified parameters already exists on the server.

value.message: Checkout with this checkout reference and pay to email already exists

get.description: Lists created checkout resources according to the applied `checkout_reference`.

parameters.name: checkout_reference
parameters.description: Filters the list of checkout resources by the unique ID of the checkout.

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

get.description: Retrieves an identified checkout resource. Use this request after processing a checkout to confirm its status and inform the end user respectively.

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

put.description:
Processing a checkout will attempt to charge the provided payment instrument for the amount of the specified checkout resource initiated in the `Create a checkout` endpoint.

Follow this request with `Retrieve a checkout` to confirm its status.

requestBody.description: Details of the payment instrument for processing the checkout.

ProcessCard.description: Process a checkout with a card

mandate.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36

ProcessToken.description: Process a checkout with a token

CheckoutSuccessCard.description: Successfully processed checkout with a card

CheckoutSuccessToken.description: Successfully processed checkout with a token

Multiple_Invalid_Parameters.description: Multiple required parameters have invalid values.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Updates an identified saved customer resource's personal details.

The request only overwrites the parameters included in the request, all other parameters will remain with their initially assigned values.

parameters.name: txn_id
parameters.description: Unique ID of the transaction.

post.description: Refunds an identified transaction either in full or partially.

schema.description: Optional amount for partial refunds of transactions.

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. Eligible amount can't exceed the amount of the transaction and varies based on country and currency. If you do not specify a value, the system performs a full refund of the transaction.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

Transaction_Not_Refundable.description: The state of the identified transaction resource does not permit the requested operation.

value.message: The transaction is not refundable in its current state

get.description:
Retrieves the full details of an identified transaction. The transaction resource is identified by a query parameter and *one* of following parameters is required:

 *  `id`
 *  `internal_id`
 *  `transaction_code`
 *  `foreign_transaction_id`
 *  `client_transaction_id`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction ID (the `id` parameter in the transaction resource).

parameters.name: internal_id
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified internal transaction ID (the `internal_id` parameter in the transaction resource).

parameters.name: transaction_code
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.

parameters.name: foreign_transaction_id
parameters.description: External/foreign transaction id (passed by clients).

parameters.name: client_transaction_id
parameters.description: Client transaction id.

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

get.description:
Retrieves the full details of an identified transaction. The transaction resource is identified by a query parameter and *one* of following parameters is required:

 *  `id`
 *  `internal_id`
 *  `transaction_code`
 *  `foreign_transaction_id`
 *  `client_transaction_id`

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction ID (the `id` parameter in the transaction resource).

parameters.name: internal_id
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified internal transaction ID (the `internal_id` parameter in the transaction resource).

parameters.name: transaction_code
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

get.description: Lists detailed history of all transactions associated with the merchant profile.

parameters.name: transaction_code
parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Specifies the order in which the returned results are displayed.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results per page. Value must be a positive integer and if not specified, will return 10 results.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: Filters the returned results by user email.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of final statuses of the transactions.

parameters.name: payment_types
parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of payment types used for the transactions.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of transaction types.

parameters.name: changes_since
parameters.description: Filters the results by the latest modification time of resources and returns only transactions that are modified *at or after* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).

parameters.name: newest_time
parameters.description: Filters the results by the creation time of resources and returns only transactions that are created *before* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).

parameters.name: newest_ref
parameters.description: Filters the results by the reference ID of transaction events and returns only transactions with events whose IDs are *smaller* than the specified value. This parameters supersedes the `newest_time` parameter (if both are provided in the request).

parameters.name: oldest_time
parameters.description: Filters the results by the creation time of resources and returns only transactions that are created *at or after* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).

parameters.name: oldest_ref
parameters.description: Filters the results by the reference ID of transaction events and returns only transactions with events whose IDs are *greater* than the specified value. This parameters supersedes the `oldest_time` parameter (if both are provided in the request).

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

get.description: Returns list of operators for currently authorized user's merchant.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Search query used to filter users that match given query term.

Current implementation allow querying only over the email address.
All operators whos email address contains the query string are returned.

parameters.name: include_primary
parameters.description: If true the list of operators will include also the primary user.

get.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, to list users in your merchant account please use [List members](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members/list) instead.

post.description: Creates new operator for currently authorized users' merchant.

403.description: Error response for compat API calls.

post.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, to create a user in your merchant account please use [Create member](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members/create) instead.

get.description: Returns specific operator.

parameters.name: operator_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the operator.

get.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, to get a user that's a member of your merchant account please use [Get member](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members/get) instead.

put.description: Updates operator. If the operator was disabled and their password is updated they will be unblocked.

parameters.name: operator_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the operator.

400.description: Invalid Operators' email or password was already used.

put.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, to update a user that's a member of your merchant account please use [Update member](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members/update) instead.

delete.description: Disable the specified operator for the merchant account.

parameters.name: operator_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the operator.

delete.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, to remove a user that's a member of your merchant account please use [Delete member](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members/delete) instead.

get.description: List memberships of the current user.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first member to return.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of members to return.

parameters.name: kind
parameters.description: Filter memberships by resource kind.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter the returned memberships by the membership status.

parameters.name: resource.type
parameters.description: Filter memberships by resource kind.

parameters.name: resource.attributes.sandbox
parameters.description: Filter memberships by the sandbox status of the resource the membership is in.

parameters.name: resource.name
parameters.description: Filter memberships by the name of the resource the membership is in.

200.description: Returns a list of Membership objects.

get.description: Lists merchant members.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first member to return.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of members to return.

parameters.name: scroll
parameters.description: Indicates to skip count query.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Filter the returned members by email address prefix.

parameters.name: user.id
parameters.description: Search for a member by user id.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter the returned members by the membership status.

parameters.name: roles
parameters.description: Filter the returned members by role.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant code.

200.description: Returns a list of Member objects.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant code.

is_managed_user.description: True if the user is managed by the merchant. In this case, we'll created a virtual user with the provided password and nickname.

email.description: Email address of the member to add.

password.description: Password of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true. In the case of service accounts, the password is not used and can not be defined by the caller.

nickname.description: Nickname of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true. Used for display purposes only.

roles.description: List of roles to assign to the new member.

201.description: Returns the Member object if the creation succeeded.

429.description: Too many invitations sent to that user. The limit is 10 requests per 5 minutes and the Retry-After header is set to the number of minutes until the reset of the limit.

get.description: Retrieve a merchant member.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant code.

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member to retrieve.

200.description: Returns the Member object for a valid identifier.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant code.

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member to retrieve.

user.description: Allows you to update user data of managed users.

nickname.description: User's preferred name. Used for display purposes only.

password.description: Password of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true.

200.description: Returns the updated Member object if the update succeeded.

400.description: Cannot set password or nickname for an invited user.

403.description: Cannot change password for managed user. Password was already used before.

409.description: Cannot update member as some data conflict with existing members.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant code.

parameters.name: member_id
parameters.description: The ID of the member to retrieve.

200.description: Returns an empty response if the deletion succeeded.

parameters.name: role_id

description.example: Manges the shop and the employees.

200.description: Returns the updated Role object if the update succeeded.

get.description: Retrieve a merchant.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the resource. At the moment, the only supported value is `latest`. When provided and the requested resource's `change_status` is pending, the resource will be returned with all pending changes applied. When no changes are pending the resource is returned as is. The `change_status` in the response body will reflect the current state of the resource.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Short unique identifier for the merchant.

200.description: Returns a Merchant for a valid identifier.

404.description: No user with the specified ID exists.

get.description: Returns a list of persons related to the merchant.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the resource. At the moment, the only supported value is `latest`. When provided and the requested resource's `change_status` is pending, the resource will be returned with all pending changes applied. When no changes are pending the resource is returned as is. The `change_status` in the response body will reflect the current state of the resource.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Short unique identifier for the merchant.

200.description: Returns a list of persons for a valid merchant identifier.

404.description: No user with the specified ID exists.

get.description: Returns a single person related to the merchant.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the resource. At the moment, the only supported value is `latest`. When provided and the requested resource's `change_status` is pending, the resource will be returned with all pending changes applied. When no changes are pending the resource is returned as is. The `change_status` in the response body will reflect the current state of the resource.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Short unique identifier for the merchant.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: Person ID

200.description: Returns a Person for a valid identifier.

404.description: No user with the specified ID exists.

get.description: List all readers of the merchant.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the merchant account.

post.description: Create a new Reader for the merchant account.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the merchant account.

201.description: Returns the Reader object if the creation succeeded.

created.summary: A reader that waits for the physical device to acknowledge the pairing.

UpdateReaderByID.description: Update the reader object. This can be used to set a name after using this endpoint to verify the pairing code.

get.description: Retrieve a Reader.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description:
Return the reader only if it has been modified after the specified timestamp given in the headers.

Timestamps are accepted in the following formats:

 - HTTP Standard: [IMF format (RFC 5322)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5322#section-3.3), sometimes also referred to as [RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the merchant account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.

200.description: Returns a Reader object for a valid identifier.

404.description: The requested Reader resource does not exists.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the merchant account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.

200.description: Returns an empty response if the deletion succeeded.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the merchant account.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.

200.description: Returns the updated Reader object if the update succeeded.

403.description: The reader is not linked to the merchant account.

post.description:
Creates a Checkout for a Reader.

This process is asynchronous and the actual transaction may take some time to be stared on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise checkout won't be accepted
* After the checkout is accepted, the system has 60 seconds to start the payment on the target device. During this time, any other checkout for the same device will be rejected.


**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.24.3 or higher.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant Code

parameters.name: reader_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Reader

201.description: The Checkout got successfully created for the given reader.

400.description: Response when given params (or one of them) are invalid

422.description: Response when given params (or one of them) are invalid

200.description:
Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.
If the server returns any other code, the callback will be retried up to 5 times with exponential backoff.

post.description:
Terminate a Reader Checkout stops the current transaction on the target device.

This process is asynchronous and the actual termination may take some time to be performed on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise terminate won't be accepted
* The action will succeed only if the device is waiting for cardholder action: e.g: waiting for card, waiting for PIN, etc.
* There is no confirmation of the termination.

If a transaction is successfully terminated and `return_url` was provided on Checkout, the transaction status will be sent as `failed` to the provided URL.


**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.28.0 or higher.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Merchant Code

parameters.name: reader_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the Reader

202.description: The Terminate action was successfully dispatched for the given reader.

400.description: Response when given params (or one of them) are invalid

422.description: Response when given params (or one of them) are invalid

ChangesSinceFilter.name: changes_since
ChangesSinceFilter.description: Filters the results by the latest modification time of resources and returns only transactions that are modified *at or after* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).

CheckoutID.name: id
CheckoutID.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

CheckoutReference.name: checkout_reference
CheckoutReference.description: Filters the list of checkout resources by the unique ID of the checkout.

CustomerID.name: customer_id
CustomerID.description: Unique ID of the saved customer resource.

GeoCoordinatesFilter.name: geo_coordinates
GeoCoordinatesFilter.description:
Filters the results by the geographical coordinates of the location where the transaction is made (as retrieved from the terminal device) and returns only results that fall within the specified rectangular area. The accepted format is a comma-separated list of coordinate points that form a rectangle defined by the following parameters:

  * `southwest_lng` (for the longitude value of the southwestern edge of the rectangle)
  * `southwest_lat` (for the latitude value of the southwestern edge of the rectangle)
  * `northeast_lng` (for the longitude value of the northeastern edge of the rectangle)
  * `northeast_lat` (for the latitude value of the northeastern edge of the rectangle)

LimitFilter.name: limit
LimitFilter.description: Specifies the maximum number of results per page. Value must be a positive integer and if not specified, will return 10 results.

NewestRefFilter.name: newest_ref
NewestRefFilter.description: Filters the results by the reference ID of transaction events and returns only transactions with events whose IDs are *smaller* than the specified value. This parameters supersedes the `newest_time` parameter (if both are provided in the request).

NewestTimeFilter.name: newest_time
NewestTimeFilter.description: Filters the results by the creation time of resources and returns only transactions that are created *before* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).

OrderFilter.name: order
OrderFilter.description: Specifies the order in which the returned results are displayed.

PaymentTypesFilter.name: payment_types
PaymentTypesFilter.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of payment types used for the transactions.

ReadersFilter.name: readers
ReadersFilter.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of serial numbers of the terminal readers used for the transactions.

StatusesFilter.name: statuses
StatusesFilter.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of final statuses of the transactions.

Token.name: token
Token.description: Unique token identifying the card saved as a payment instrument resource.

TransactionCode.name: transaction_code
TransactionCode.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.

TransactionID.name: id
TransactionID.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction ID (the `id` parameter in the transaction resource).

TypesFilter.name: types
TypesFilter.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of transaction types.

UsersFilter.name: users
UsersFilter.description: Filters the returned results by user email.

country.description: Two letter country code formatted according to [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).

line_1.description: First line of the address with details of the street name and number.

line_2.description: Second line of the address with details of the building, unit, apartment, and floor numbers.

state.description: State name or abbreviation from the address.

primary.description: The primary bank account is the one used for payouts

created_at.description: Creation date of the bank account

last_name.description: BO's last name of the user

Card.description: __Required when payment type is `card`.__ Details of the payment card.

name.description: Name of the cardholder as it appears on the payment card.

number.description: Number of the payment card (without spaces).

expiry_year.description: Year from the expiration time of the payment card. Accepted formats are `YY` and `YYYY`.

expiry_month.description: Month from the expiration time of the payment card. Accepted format is `MM`.

cvv.description: Three or four-digit card verification value (security code) of the payment card.

zip_code.description: Required five-digit ZIP code. Applicable only to merchant users in the USA.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

checkout_reference.description: Unique ID of the payment checkout specified by the client application when creating the checkout resource.

merchant_code.description: Unique identifying code of the merchant profile.

description.description: Short description of the checkout visible in the SumUp dashboard. The description can contribute to reporting, allowing easier identification of a checkout.

return_url.description: URL to which the SumUp platform sends the processing status of the payment checkout.

id.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

date.description: Date and time of the creation of the payment checkout. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

valid_until.description: Date and time of the checkout expiration before which the client application needs to send a processing request. If no value is present, the checkout does not have an expiration time.

customer_id.description: Unique identification of a customer. If specified, the checkout session and payment instrument are associated with the referenced customer.

transactions.description: List of transactions related to the payment.

checkout_reference.description: Unique ID of the payment checkout specified by the client application when creating the checkout resource.

merchant_code.description: Unique identifying code of the merchant profile.

description.description: Short description of the checkout visible in the SumUp dashboard. The description can contribute to reporting, allowing easier identification of a checkout.

return_url.description: URL to which the SumUp platform sends the processing status of the payment checkout.

customer_id.description: Unique identification of a customer. If specified, the checkout session and payment instrument are associated with the referenced customer.

id.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

date.description: Date and time of the creation of the payment checkout. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

valid_until.description: Date and time of the checkout expiration before which the client application needs to send a processing request. If no value is present, the checkout does not have an expiration time.

transactions.description: List of transactions related to the payment.

redirect_url.description: __Required__ for [APMs](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/apm/introduction) and __recommended__ for card payments. Refers to a url where the end user is redirected once the payment processing completes. If not specified, the [Payment Widget](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/tools/card-widget) renders [3DS challenge](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/features/3ds) within an iframe instead of performing a full-page redirect.

ProcessCheckout.description: Details of the payment instrument for processing the checkout.

payment_type.description: Describes the payment method used to attempt processing

installments.description: Number of installments for deferred payments. Available only to merchant users in Brazil.

token.description: __Required when using a tokenized card to process a checkout.__ Unique token identifying the saved payment card for a customer.

customer_id.description: __Required when `token` is provided.__ Unique ID of the customer.

transaction_code.description: Transaction code of the successful transaction with which the payment for the checkout is completed.

transaction_id.description: Transaction ID of the successful transaction with which the payment for the checkout is completed.

redirect_url.description: Refers to a url where the end user is redirected once the payment processing completes.

payment_instrument.description: Object containing token information for the specified payment instrument

url.description: Where the end user is redirected.

method.description: Method used to complete the redirect.

redirect_url.description: Refers to a url where the end user is redirected once the payment processing completes.

mechanism.description: Indicates allowed mechanisms for redirecting an end user. If both values are provided to ensure a redirect takes place in either.

payload.description: Contains parameters essential for form redirection. Number of object keys and their content can vary.

company_registration_number.description: Doing business as company registration number

param.description: Parameter name (with relative location) to which the error applies. Parameters from embedded resources are displayed using dot notation. For example, `card.name` refers to the `name` parameter embedded in the `card` object.

status_code.description: HTTP status code for the error.

fee_amount.description: Amount of the fee related to the event.

deducted_fee_amount.description: Amount of the fee deducted for the event.

LegalTypeLegacy.description: Id of the legal type of the merchant profile

sole_trader.description: Sole trader legal type if true

Link.description: Details of a link to a related resource.

rel.description: Specifies the relation to the current resource.

href.description: URL for accessing the related resource.

type.description: Specifies the media type of the related resource.

MandatePayload.description: Mandate is passed when a card is to be tokenized

user_agent.description: Operating system and web client used by the end-user

user_ip.description: IP address of the end user. Supports IPv4 and IPv6

example.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36

merchant_code.description: Merchant code which has the mandate
Unique identifying code of the merchant profile

nature_and_purpose.description: Nature and purpose of the business

extdev.description: True if the merchant is extdev

payout_zone_migrated.description: True if the payout zone of this merchant is migrated

country.description: Merchant country code formatted according to [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) (for internal usage only)

tax_enabled.description: Whether to show tax in receipts (saved per transaction)

payout_on_demand_available.description: Whether merchant can edit payouts on demand

payout_on_demand.description: Whether merchant will receive payouts on demand

printers_enabled.description: Whether to show printers in mobile app

moto_payment.description: Whether merchant can make MOTO payments

daily_payout_email.description: Whether merchant will receive daily payout emails

monthly_payout_email.description: Whether merchant will receive monthly payout emails

gross_settlement.description: Whether merchant has gross settlement enabled

token.description: Unique token identifying the saved payment card for a customer.

active.description: Indicates whether the payment instrument is active and can be used for payments. To deactivate it, send a `DELETE` request to the resource endpoint.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

created_at.description: Creation date of payment instrument. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

full_transaction_history_view.description: Can view full merchant transaction history

birth_date.description: Date of birth of the customer.

tax_id.description: An identification number user for tax purposes (e.g. CPF)

Product.description: Details of the product for which the payment is made.

name.description: Name of the product from the merchant's catalog.

price.description: Price of the product without VAT.

vat_rate.description: VAT rate applicable to the product.

single_vat_amount.description: Amount of the VAT for a single product item (calculated as the product of `price` and `vat_rate`, i.e. `single_vat_amount = price * vat_rate`).

price_with_vat.description: Price of a single product item with VAT.

vat_amount.description: Total VAT amount for the purchase (calculated as the product of `single_vat_amount` and `quantity`, i.e. `vat_amount = single_vat_amount * quantity`).

quantity.description: Number of product items for the purchase.

total_price.description: Total price of the product items without VAT (calculated as the product of `price` and `quantity`, i.e. `total_price = price * quantity`).

total_with_vat.description: Total price of the product items including VAT (calculated as the product of `price_with_vat` and `quantity`, i.e. `total_with_vat = price_with_vat * quantity`).

due_date.description: Date when the transaction event is due to occur.

date.description: Date when the transaction event occurred.

installment_number.description: Consecutive number of the installment that is paid. Applicable only payout events, i.e. `event_type = PAYOUT`.

transaction_code.description: Transaction code returned by the acquirer/processing entity after processing the transaction.

timestamp.description: Date and time of the creation of the transaction. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

payment_type.description: Payment type used for the transaction.

installments_count.description: Current number of the installment for deferred payments.

merchant_code.description: Unique code of the registered merchant to whom the payment is made.

vat_amount.description: Amount of the applicable VAT (out of the total transaction amount).

tip_amount.description: Amount of the tip (out of the total transaction amount).

entry_mode.description: Entry mode of the payment details.

auth_code.description: Authorization code for the transaction sent by the payment card issuer or bank. Applicable only to card payments.

internal_id.description: Internal unique ID of the transaction on the SumUp platform.

product_summary.description: Short description of the payment. The value is taken from the `description` property of the related checkout resource.

payouts_total.description: Total number of payouts to the registered user specified in the `user` property.

payouts_received.description: Number of payouts that are made to the registered user specified in the `user` property.

payout_plan.description: Payout plan of the registered user at the time when the transaction was made.

user.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made.

type.description: Type of the transaction for the registered user specified in the `user` property.

card_type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card used for the transaction.

username.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made.

simple_payment_type.description: Simple name of the payment type.

verification_method.description: Verification method used for the transaction.

local_time.description: Local date and time of the creation of the transaction.

products.description: List of products from the merchant's catalogue for which the transaction serves as a payment.

vat_rates.description: List of VAT rates applicable to the transaction.

transaction_events.description: List of transaction events related to the transaction.

simple_status.description: Status generated from the processing status and the latest transaction state.

links.description: List of hyperlinks for accessing related resources.

events.description: List of events related to the transaction.

location.description: Details of the payment location as received from the payment terminal.

tax_enabled.description: Indicates whether tax deduction is enabled for the transaction.

Currency.description: Three-letter [ISO4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code of the currency for the amount. Currently supported currency values are enumerated above.

EventID.description: Unique ID of the transaction event.

HorizontalAccuracy.description: Indication of the precision of the geographical position received from the payment terminal.

Lat.description: Latitude value from the coordinates of the payment location (as received from the payment terminal reader).

min_amount.description: Minimum allowed amount for the refund.

max_amount.description: Maximum allowed amount for the refund.

Lon.description: Longitude value from the coordinates of the payment location (as received from the payment terminal reader).

TimestampEvent.description: Date and time of the transaction event.

Permissions.description: Permissions assigned to an operator or user.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the operator was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the operator was last updated.

CompatError.description: Error object for compat API calls.

Metadata.description: Set of user-defined key-value pairs attached to the object. Partial updates are not supported. When updating, always submit whole metadata.

Attributes.description: Object attributes that are modifiable only by SumUp applications.

CountryCode.description:
An [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)
country code. This definition users `oneOf` with a two-character string
type to allow for support of future countries in client code.

Address.description:
An address somewhere in the world. The address fields used depend on the country conventions. For example, in Great Britain, `city` is `post_town`. In the United States, the top-level administrative unit used in addresses is `state`, whereas in Chile it's `region`.
Whether an address is valid or not depends on whether the locally required fields are present. Fields not supported in a country will be ignored.

items.description: The first line of the address.

post_code.description: The postal code (aka. zip code) of the address.

province.description: The province where the address is located. This may not be relevant in some countries.

region.description: The region where the address is located. This may not be relevant in some countries.

county.description: A county is a geographic region of a country used for administrative or other purposes in some nations. Used in countries such as Ireland, Romania, etc.

autonomous_community.description: In Spain, an autonomous community is the first sub-national level of political and administrative division.

post_town.description: A post town is a required part of all postal addresses in the United Kingdom and Ireland, and a basic unit of the postal delivery system.

state.description: Most often, a country has a single state, with various administrative divisions. The term "state" is sometimes used to refer to the federated polities that make up the federation. Used in countries such as the United States and Brazil.

neighborhood.description: Locality level of the address. Used in countries such as Brazil or Chile.

commune.description: In many countries, terms cognate with "commune" are used, referring to the community living in the area and the common interest. Used in countries such as Chile.

department.description: A department (French: département, Spanish: departamento) is an administrative or political division in several countries. Used in countries such as Colombia.

municipality.description: A municipality is usually a single administrative division having corporate status and powers of self-government or jurisdiction as granted by national and regional laws to which it is subordinate. Used in countries such as Colombia.

district.description: A district is a type of administrative division that in some countries is managed by the local government. Used in countries such as Portugal.

zip_code.description: A US system of postal codes used by the United States Postal Service (USPS).

ref.description: The unique reference for the personal identifier type.

ResourceType.description:
The type of the membership resource.
Possible values are:
* `merchant` - merchant account(s)
* `organization` - organization(s)

Membership.description: A membership associates a user with a resource, memberships is defined by user, resource, resource type, and associated roles.

resource_id.description: ID of the resource the membership is in.

permissions.x-deprecation-notice: Permissions include only legacy permissions, please use roles instead. Member access is based on their roles within a given resource and the permissions these roles grant.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the membership was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the membership was last updated.

Membership.title: Membership

MembershipResource.description: Information about the resource the membership is in.

id.description: ID of the resource the membership is in.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the membership resource was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the membership resource was last updated.

MembershipResource.title: Resource

Member.description: A member is user within specific resource identified by resource id, resource type, and associated roles.

permissions.x-deprecation-notice: Permissions include only legacy permissions, please use roles instead. Member access is based on roles within a given resource and the permissions these roles grant.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the member was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the member was last updated.

Member.title: Member

email.description: Email address of the invited user.

MembershipUser.description: Information about the user associated with the membership.

id.description: Identifier for the End-User (also called Subject).

email.description: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, for unique identification use ID instead.

mfa_on_login_enabled.description: True if the user has enabled MFA on login.

virtual_user.description: True if the user is a virtual user (operator).

service_account_user.description: True if the user is a service account.

disabled_at.description: Time when the user has been disabled. Applies only to virtual users (`virtual_user: true`).

nickname.description: User's preferred name. Used for display purposes only.

picture.description: URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL refers to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image.

Role.description: A custom role that can be used to assign set of permissions to members.

description.example: Manges the shop and the employees.

permissions.description: List of permission granted by this role.
permissions.x-deprecation-notice: Permissions include only legacy permissions, please use roles instead. Member access is based on their roles within a given resource and the permissions these roles grant.

is_predefined.description: True if the role is provided by SumUp.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the role was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the role was last updated.

Role.title: Role

merchant_code.description: Short unique identifier for the merchant.

organization_id.description: ID of the organization the merchant belongs to (if any).

business_type.description:
The business type.
* `sole_trader`: The business is run by an self-employed individual.
* `company`: The business is run as a company with one or more shareholders
* `partnership`: The business is run as a company with two or more shareholders that can be also other legal entities
* `non_profit`: The business is run as a nonprofit organization that operates for public or social benefit
* `government_entity`: The business is state owned and operated

avatar.description: A user-facing small-format logo for use in dashboards and other user-facing applications. For customer-facing branding see `merchant.business_profile.branding`.

alias.description: A user-facing name of the merchant account for use in dashboards and other user-facing applications. For customer-facing business name see `merchant.business_profile`.

default_currency.description: Three-letter [ISO currency code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) representing the default currency for the account.

default_locale.description:
Merchant's default locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5646) language tag. This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1](https://www.iso.org/iso-639-language-code) language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code in uppercase, separated by a dash. For example, en-US or fr-CA.
In multilingual countries this is the merchant's preferred locale out of those, that are officially spoken in the country. In a countries with a single official language this will match the official language.

sandbox.description: True if the merchant is a sandbox for testing.

Company.description: Information about the company or business. This is legal information that is used for verification.

merchant_category_code.description: The merchant category code for the account as specified by [ISO18245](https://www.iso.org/standard/33365.html). MCCs are used to classify businesses based on the goods or services they provide.

website.description: HTTP(S) URL of the company's website.

Meta.description:
A set of key-value pairs that you can attach to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format.

**Warning**: Updating Meta will overwrite the existing data. Make sure to always include the complete JSON object.

BusinessProfile.description: Business information about the merchant. This information will be visible to the merchant's customers.

dynamic_descriptor.description:
The descriptor is the text that your customer sees on their bank account statement.
The more recognisable your descriptor is, the less risk you have of receiving disputes (e.g. chargebacks).

PhoneNumber.description: A publicly available phone number in [E.164](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164) format.

Branding.description: Settings used to apply the Merchant's branding to email receipts, invoices, checkouts, and other products.

icon.description: An icon for the merchant. Must be square.

logo.description: A logo for the merchant that will be used in place of the icon and without the merchant's name next to it if there's sufficient space.

hero.description: Data-URL encoded hero image for the merchant business.

primary_color.description: A hex color value representing the primary branding color of this merchant (your brand color).

primary_color_fg.description: A hex color value representing the color of the text displayed on branding color of this merchant.

secondary_color.description: A hex color value representing the secondary branding color of this merchant (accent color used for buttons).

secondary_color_fg.description: A hex color value representing the color of the text displayed on secondary branding color of this merchant.

background_color.description: A hex color value representing the preferred background color of this merchant.

LegalType.description: The unique legal type reference as defined in the country SDK. We do not rely on IDs as used by other services. Consumers of this API are expected to use the country SDK to map to any other IDs, translation keys, or descriptions.

externalDocs.description: The country SDK documentation for legal types.

CompanyIdentifiers.description: A list of country-specific company identifiers.

ref.description: The unique reference for the company identifier type as defined in the country SDK.

share.description: The percent of ownership shares held by the person expressed in percent mille (1/100000). Only persons with the relationship `owner` can have ownership.

Version.description: The version of the resource. The version reflects a specific change submitted to the API via one of the `PATCH` endpoints.

ChangeStatus.description:
Reflects the status of changes submitted through the `PATCH` endpoints for the merchant or persons. If some changes have not been applied yet, the status will be `pending`. If all changes have been applied, the status `done`.
The status is only returned after write operations or on read endpoints when the `version` query parameter is provided.

BasePerson.description: Base schema for a person associated with a merchant. This can be a legal representative, business owner (ultimate beneficial owner), or an officer. A legal representative is the person who registered the merchant with SumUp. They should always have a `user_id`.

id.description: The unique identifier for the person. This is a [typeid](https://github.com/sumup/typeid).

user_id.description: A corresponding identity user ID for the person, if they have a user account.

birthdate.description: The date of birth of the individual, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 [ISO8601‑2004] YYYY-MM-DD format.

given_name.description: The first name(s) of the individual.

family_name.description: The last name(s) of the individual.

middle_name.description: Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

relationships.description: A list of roles the person has in the merchant or towards SumUp. A merchant must have at least one person with the relationship `representative`.

items.description:
* `representative`: The person is the primary contact for SumUp and has full administrative power over the merchant account.
* `owner`: The person is a business owner. If this value is set, the `ownership_percent` should be set as well.
* `officer`: The person is an officer at the company.

identifiers.description: A list of country-specific personal identifiers.

nationality.description: The persons nationality. May be an [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code, but legacy data may not conform to this standard.

country_of_residence.description: An [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code representing the country where the person resides.

created_at.description: The date and time when the resource was created. This is a string as defined in [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

updated_at.description: The date and time when the resource was last updated. This is a string as defined in [RFC 3339, section 5.6](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

instance.description: A unique identifier for the error instance. This can be used to trace the error back to the server logs.

message.description: A human-readable message describing the error that occurred.

ErrorCodeNotFound.description: An error code specifying the exact error that occurred.

ErrorCodeInternalServerError.description: An error code specifying the exact error that occurred.

Reader.description: A physical card reader device that can accept in-person payments.

created_at.description: The timestamp of when the reader was created.

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the reader was last updated.

Reader.title: Reader

ReaderID.description:
Unique identifier of the object.
Note that this identifies the instance of the physical devices pairing with your SumUp account.
If you DELETE a reader, and pair the device again, the ID will be different. Do not use this ID to refer to a physical device.

ReaderName.description: Custom human-readable, user-defined name for easier identification of the reader.

ReaderStatus.description:
The status of the reader object gives information about the current state of the reader.

Possible values:

- `unknown` - The reader status is unknown.
- `processing` - The reader is created and waits for the physical device to confirm the pairing.
- `paired` - The reader is paired with a merchant account and can be used with SumUp APIs.
- `expired` - The pairing is expired and no longer usable with the account. The resource needs to get recreated.

ReaderDevice.description: Information about the underlying physical device.

identifier.description: A unique identifier of the physical device (e.g. serial number).

model.description: Identifier of the model of the device.

ReaderPairingCode.description: The pairing code is a 8 or 9 character alphanumeric string that is displayed on a SumUp Device after initiating the pairing. It is used to link the physical device to the created pairing.

DataValidation.description: Validation errors for the informed fields.

ReaderCheckoutPending.description: Error returned when a checkout was requested in the last 60 seconds.

errors.detail: A pending transaction already exists for this device

ReaderOffline.description: Error returned when the target device is not online.
Error returned when the target device is not online.

client_transaction_id.description:
The client transaction ID is a unique identifier for the transaction that is generated for the client.

It can be used later to fetch the transaction details via the [Transactions API](https://developer.sumup.com/api/transactions/get).

affiliate.description:
Affiliate metadata for the transaction.
It is a field that allow for integrators to track the source of the transaction.

app_id.description:
Application ID of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the application and should be set by the integrator in the [Affiliate Keys](https://developer.sumup.com/affiliate-keys) page.

foreign_transaction_id.description:
Foreign transaction ID of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the transaction.
It can be used later to fetch the transaction details via the [Transactions API](https://developer.sumup.com/api/transactions/get).

key.description:
Key of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the key  and should be generated by the integrator in the [Affiliate Keys](https://developer.sumup.com/affiliate-keys) page.

tags.description:
Additional metadata for the transaction.
It is key-value object that can be associated with the transaction.

affiliate.title: Affiliate

card_type.description:
The card type of the card used for the transaction.
Is is required only for some countries (e.g: Brazil).

description.description: Description of the checkout to be shown in the Merchant Sales

installments.description:
Number of installments for the transaction.
It may vary according to the merchant country.
For example, in Brazil, the maximum number of installments is 12.

return_url.description:
Webhook URL to which the payment result will be sent.
It must be a HTTPS url.

tip_rates.description:
List of tipping rates to be displayed to the cardholder.
The rates are in percentage and should be between 0.01 and 0.99.
The list should be sorted in ascending order.

tip_timeout.description:
Time in seconds the cardholder has to select a tip rate.
If not provided, the default value is 30 seconds.

It can only be set if `tip_rates` is provided.

**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.38.0 or higher.

total_amount.description:
Amount structure.

The amount is represented as an integer value altogether with the currency and the minor unit.

For example, EUR 1.00 is represented as value 100 with minor unit of 2.

minor_unit.description:
The minor units of the currency.
It represents the number of decimals of the currency. For the currencies CLP, COP and HUF, the minor unit is 0.

total_amount.title: Money

ReaderCheckoutStatusChange.description: The callback payload containing the status change of the Reader Checkout.

client_transaction_id.description: The unique client transaction id. It is the same returned by the Checkout.

merchant_code.description: The merchant code associated with the transaction.

status.description: The current status of the transaction.

transaction_id.description: The transaction id. Deprecated: use `client_transaction_id` instead.

ReaderCheckoutStatusChange.title: ReaderCheckoutStatusChange

primary.description: Determines if this bank account will be primary. Default is false

account_category.description: Determines if this bank account is business or personal.

legal_type_id.description: Id of the legal type of the merchant

nature_and_purpose.description: Nature and purpose of the business. Required for the following merchant category codes: 5999, 7392, 8999, 5694, 5969, 7299, 7399

is_test_account.description: Defines if the profile nature is for testing

payout_on_demand.description: If true, the merchant will not receive automatic payouts.

payout_on_demand_available.description: If true, the merchant will be able to manage  payout_on_demand settings

expected_max_transaction_amount.description: Expected maximum amount of a single purchase

PaymentInstrumentCard.description: Details of the payment card that is saved as a payment instrument.

token.description: Unique token identifying the saved payment card for a customer.

active.description: Indicates whether the payment instrument is active and can be used for payments. To deactivate it, send a `DELETE` request to the resource endpoint.

national_id.description: National identification id. Country specific. Ex CPF (Brazil), DNI (Spain), PESEL (Poland)

CreatedReader.summary: A reader that waits for the physical device to acknowledge the pairing.

UpdateReaderByID.description: Update the reader object. This can be used to set a name after using this endpoint to verify the pairing code.

Checkout.description: Standard request body for creating a checkout

CheckoutAPM.description: Create an Alternative Payment Method checkout

CheckoutProcess.description: Details of the payment instrument for processing the checkout.

ProcessCard.description: Process a checkout with a card

mandate.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36

ProcessToken.description: Process a checkout with a token

schema.description: Optional amount for partial refunds of transactions.

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. Eligible amount can't exceed the amount of the transaction and varies based on country and currency. If you do not specify a value, the system performs a full refund of the transaction.

Checkout.description: Standard response body for a successfully created checkout

Checkout3DS.description: Response body for a successfully created 3DS checkout

CheckoutAPM.description: Response body for APMs, including Blik, iDeal, ...

CheckoutSuccessCard.description: Successfully processed checkout with a card

CheckoutSuccessToken.description: Successfully processed checkout with a token

Invalid_Token.description: The access token is invalid or has expired.

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Forbidden.description: You do not have required scopes for making this request.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

Checkout_Processed.description: The identified checkout resource is already processed.

CompatErrorResponse.description: Error response for compat API calls.

ListMemberships.description: Returns a list of Membership objects.

ListMembers.description: Returns a list of Member objects.

ListRoles.description: Returns a list of Role objects.

404NotFound.description: No user with the specified ID exists.

apiKey.description: API keys allow you easily interact with SumUp APIs. API keys are static tokens. You can create API keys from the [Dashboard](https://me.sumup.com/settings/api-keys)

oauth2.description:
SumUp supports [OAuth 2.0](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) authentication for platforms that want to offer their services to SumUp users.

To integrate via OAuth 2.0 you will need a client credentials that you can create in the [SumUp Dashboard](https://me.sumup.com/settings/oauth2-applications).

To maintain security of our users, we highly recommend that you use one of the [recommended OAuth 2.0 libraries](https://oauth.net/code/) for authentication.

scopes.payments: Make payments by creating and processing checkouts.
scopes.user.profile: View and manage your user profile.
scopes.user.app-settings: View and manage the SumUp mobile application settings.
scopes.payment_instruments: Manage customers and their payment instruments.
scopes.user.payout-settings: View and manage your payout settings.
scopes.user.subaccounts: View and manage the user profile details of your employees.

scopes.payments: Make payments by creating and processing checkouts.
scopes.user.profile: View and manage your user profile.
scopes.user.app-settings: View and manage the SumUp mobile application settings.
scopes.payment_instruments: Manage customers and their payment instruments.
scopes.user.payout-settings: View and manage your payout settings.

tags.name: Checkouts
tags.description:
Accept payments from your end users by adding the Checkouts model to your platform.
SumUp supports standard and single payment 3DS checkout flows.

The Checkout model allows creating, listing, retrieving, processing and deactivating checkouts.
A payment is completed by creating a checkout and then processing the checkout.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description:
Allow your regular customers to save their information with the Customers model.
This will prevent re-entering payment instrument information for recurring payments on your platform.

Depending on the needs you can allow, creating, listing or deactivating payment instruments & creating, retrieving and updating customers.

tags.name: Transactions
tags.description:
Retrieve details for a specific transaction by it’s `id`
or any other required query parameter, or list all transactions related to the merchant account.

tags.name: Payouts
tags.description:
The Payouts model will allow you to track funds you’ve received from SumUp.
You can receive a detailed payouts list with information like dates, fees, references and statuses, using the `List payouts` endpoint.

tags.name: Receipts
tags.description: The Receipts model obtains receipt-like details for specific transactions.

tags.name: Subaccounts
tags.x-deprecation-notice: Subaccounts API is deprecated, please use [Members](https://developer.sumup.com/api/members) API instead to manage your account members.

tags.name: Members
tags.description: Endpoints to manage account members. Members are users that have membership within merchant accounts.

tags.name: Memberships
tags.description: Endpoints to manage user's memberships. Memberships are used to connect the user to merchant accounts and to grant them access to the merchant's resources via roles.

tags.name: Roles
tags.description: Endpoints to manage custom roles. Custom roles allow you to tailor roles from individual permissions to match your needs. Once created, you can assign your custom roles to your merchant account members using the memberships.

tags.name: Merchants
tags.description: Merchant account represents a single business entity at SumUp.

tags.name: Readers
tags.description: A reader represents a device that accepts payments. You can use the SumUp Solo to accept in-person payments.
